jsx.http
Class Http

java.lang.Object
  js.Disposable
      jsx.http.Http

public final class Http
extends Disposable

An utility class providing static methods to manipulate HTTP connections and transmissions eliminating browser dependencies.

Users are encouraged to use the utilities provided by this class instead of the opaque methods of JsXMLHttpRequest in consideration of the reuse benefit for re-compilation results.

Author:
J.J.Liu (Jianjun Liu) at http://www.jscripter.org
See Also:
Ajax

abort

public static final void abort(JsXMLHttpRequest http)

Cancels the current HTTP request, closing connections and stopping any pending network activity.

This method resets the JsXMLHttpRequest object to a JsXMLHttpRequest.readyState of JsXMLHttpRequest.UNINITIALIZED and aborts any pending network activity. You might call this method, for example, if a request has taken too long, and the response is no longer necessary.

Parameters:
http - The current HTTP request.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
JsXMLHttpRequest.abort()

getAllResponseHeaders

public static final java.lang.String getAllResponseHeaders(JsXMLHttpRequest http)

Returns the HTTP response headers as an unparsed string.

Parameters:
http - The current HTTP request.
Returns:
null if JsXMLHttpRequest.readyState is less than JsXMLHttpRequest.RECEIVING; Otherwise, it returns all HTTP response headers, but not the status line, sent by the server. The headers are returned as a single string, with one header per line. Lines are delimited by "\r\n" line terminators.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
JsXMLHttpRequest.getAllResponseHeaders()

getResponseHeader

public static final java.lang.String getResponseHeader(JsXMLHttpRequest http,
                                                       java.lang.String header)

Returns the value of a named HTTP response header.

Parameters:
http - The current HTTP request.
header - The name of the HTTP response header whose value is to be returned. the header name may be specified using any case, as the comparison to response headers is case-insensitive.
Returns:
The value of the named HTTP response header, or the empty string if no such header was received or if JsXMLHttpRequest.readyState is less than JsXMLHttpRequest.RECEIVING. If more than one header with the specified name is received, the values of those headers are concatenated and returned, using a comma and space as the delimiter.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
JsXMLHttpRequest.getResponseHeader(String)

open

public static final void open(JsXMLHttpRequest http,
                              java.lang.String method,
                              java.lang.String url)

Initializes HTTP request parameters, such as the URL and HTTP method, but does not send the request.

This method initializes request parameters for later use by the send(JsXMLHttpRequest, Object) method. It sets JsXMLHttpRequest.readyState to JsXMLHttpRequest.OPEN, deletes any previously specified request headers and previously received response headers, and sets the JsXMLHttpRequest.responseText, JsXMLHttpRequest.responseXML, JsXMLHttpRequest.status, and JsXMLHttpRequest.statusText properties to their default values. It is safe to call this method when JsXMLHttpRequest.readyState is JsXMLHttpRequest.UNINITIALIZED {when the JsXMLHttpRequest object is just created or after a call to abort(JsXMLHttpRequest)), and when JsXMLHttpRequest.readyState is JsXMLHttpRequest.LOADED, (after a response has been received). The behavior of this method is unspecified when it is called from any other state.

Other than storing request parameters for use by send(JsXMLHttpRequest, Object) and resetting the JsXMLHttpRequest object for reuse, this method has no other behavior. In particular, note that implementations do not typically open a network connection to the web server when this method is called.

Parameters:
http - The current HTTP request.
method - The HTTP method to be used for the request. Reliably implemented values include "GET", "POST", and "HEAD". Implementations may also support other methods as well.
url - The URL that is the subject of the request. Most browsers impose a same-origin security policy and require that this URL have the same host name and port as the document that contains the script. Relative URLs are resolved in the normal way, using the URL of the document that contains the script.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
open(JsXMLHttpRequest, String, String, Boolean), open(JsXMLHttpRequest, String, String, Boolean, String, String), send(JsXMLHttpRequest, Object), JsXMLHttpRequest.open(String, String)

open

public static final void open(JsXMLHttpRequest http,
                              java.lang.String method,
                              java.lang.String url,
                              java.lang.Boolean async)

Initializes HTTP request parameters, such as the URL and HTTP method, but does not send the request.

This method initializes request parameters for later use by the send(JsXMLHttpRequest, Object) method. It sets JsXMLHttpRequest.readyState to JsXMLHttpRequest.OPEN, deletes any previously specified request headers and previously received response headers, and sets the JsXMLHttpRequest.responseText, JsXMLHttpRequest.responseXML, JsXMLHttpRequest.status, and JsXMLHttpRequest.statusText properties to their default values. It is safe to call this method when JsXMLHttpRequest.readyState is JsXMLHttpRequest.UNINITIALIZED {when the JsXMLHttpRequest object is just created or after a call to abort(JsXMLHttpRequest)), and when JsXMLHttpRequest.readyState is JsXMLHttpRequest.LOADED, (after a response has been received). The behavior of this method is unspecified when it is called from any other state.

Other than storing request parameters for use by send(JsXMLHttpRequest, Object) and resetting the JsXMLHttpRequest object for reuse, this method has no other behavior. In particular, note that implementations do not typically open a network connection to the web server when this method is called.

Parameters:
http - The current HTTP request.
method - The HTTP method to be used for the request. Reliably implemented values include "GET", "POST", and "HEAD". Implementations may also support other methods as well.
url - The URL that is the subject of the request. Most browsers impose a same-origin security policy and require that this URL have the same host name and port as the document that contains the script. Relative URLs are resolved in the normal way, using the URL of the document that contains the script.
async - Specifies whether the request should be performed asynchronously or not. If this argument is false, the request is synchronous, and a subsequent call to send(JsXMLHttpRequest, Object) will block until the response is fully received. If this argument is true or is undefined, the request is asynchronous, and an JsXMLHttpRequest.onreadystatechange event handler is typically required.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
open(JsXMLHttpRequest, String, String), open(JsXMLHttpRequest, String, String, Boolean, String, String), send(JsXMLHttpRequest, Object), JsXMLHttpRequest.open(String, String, Boolean)

open

public static final void open(JsXMLHttpRequest http,
                              java.lang.String method,
                              java.lang.String url,
                              java.lang.Boolean async,
                              java.lang.String username,
                              java.lang.String password)

Initializes HTTP request parameters, such as the URL and HTTP method, but does not send the request.

This method initializes request parameters for later use by the send(JsXMLHttpRequest, Object) method. It sets JsXMLHttpRequest.readyState to JsXMLHttpRequest.OPEN, deletes any previously specified request headers and previously received response headers, and sets the JsXMLHttpRequest.responseText, JsXMLHttpRequest.responseXML, JsXMLHttpRequest.status, and JsXMLHttpRequest.statusText properties to their default values. It is safe to call this method when JsXMLHttpRequest.readyState is JsXMLHttpRequest.UNINITIALIZED {when the JsXMLHttpRequest object is just created or after a call to abort(JsXMLHttpRequest)), and when JsXMLHttpRequest.readyState is JsXMLHttpRequest.LOADED, (after a response has been received). The behavior of this method is unspecified when it is called from any other state.

Other than storing request parameters for use by send(JsXMLHttpRequest, Object) and resetting the JsXMLHttpRequest object for reuse, this method has no other behavior. In particular, note that implementations do not typically open a network connection to the web server when this method is called.

Parameters:
http - The current HTTP request.
method - The HTTP method to be used for the request. Reliably implemented values include "GET", "POST", and "HEAD". Implementations may also support other methods as well.
url - The URL that is the subject of the request. Most browsers impose a same-origin security policy and require that this URL have the same host name and port as the document that contains the script. Relative URLs are resolved in the normal way, using the URL of the document that contains the script.
async - Specifies whether the request should be performed asynchronously or not. If this argument is false, the request is synchronous, and a subsequent call to send(JsXMLHttpRequest, Object) will block until the response is fully received. If this argument is true or is undefined, the request is asynchronous, and an JsXMLHttpRequest.onreadystatechange event handler is typically required.
username - An optional argument specifying authorization user name for use with URLs that require authorization. If specified, it overrides the user name specified in the URL itself.
password - An optional argument specifying authorization password for use with URLs that require authorization. If specified, it overrides the password specified in the URL itself.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
open(JsXMLHttpRequest, String, String), open(JsXMLHttpRequest, String, String, Boolean), send(JsXMLHttpRequest, Object), JsXMLHttpRequest.open(String, String, Boolean, String, String)

send

public static final void send(JsXMLHttpRequest http)

Sends the HTTP request, using parameters passed to the open(JsXMLHttpRequest, String, String, Boolean, String, String) method and an optional request body passed to this method.

This method causes an HTTP request to be issued. If there has been no previous call to open(JsXMLHttpRequest, String, String, Boolean), or, more generally, if JsXMLHttpRequest.readyState is not JsXMLHttpRequest.OPEN, this method throws an error. Otherwise, it issues an HTTP request that consists of:

  • The HTTP method, URL, and authorization credentials (if any) specified in the previous call to open(JsXMLHttpRequest, String, String, Boolean, String, String).
  • The request headers, if any, specified by previous calls to setRequestHeader(JsXMLHttpRequest, String, String).
  • The body argument passed to this method.
Once the request has been issued, this method sets JsXMLHttpRequest.readyState to JsXMLHttpRequest.SENT and triggers the JsXMLHttpRequest.onreadystatechange event handler.

If the async argument to the previous call to open(JsXMLHttpRequest, String, String, Boolean, String, String) was false, this method blocks and does not return until JsXMLHttpRequest.readyState is JsXMLHttpRequest.LOADED and the server's response has been fully received. Otherwise, if the async argument is true or if that argument is undefined, this method returns immediately, and the server's response is processed on a background thread.

If the server responds with an HTTP redirect, this method or the background thread follow the redirect automatically. When all HTTP response headers have been received, this method or the background thread sets JsXMLHttpRequest.readyState to JsXMLHttpRequest.RECEIVING and triggers the JsXMLHttpRequest.onreadystatechange event handler. If the response is long, this method or the background thread may trigger the JsXMLHttpRequest.onreadystatechange more than once while in state JsXMLHttpRequest.RECEIVING. This can serve as a download progress indicator. Finally, when the response is complete, this method or the background thread sets JsXMLHttpRequest.readyState to JsXMLHttpRequest.LOADED and triggers the event handler one last time.

Parameters:
http - The current HTTP request.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
open(JsXMLHttpRequest, String, String), open(JsXMLHttpRequest, String, String, Boolean), open(JsXMLHttpRequest, String, String, Boolean, String, String), JsXMLHttpRequest.send(Object)

send

public static final void send(JsXMLHttpRequest http,
                              java.lang.Object body)

Sends the HTTP request, using parameters passed to the open(JsXMLHttpRequest, String, String, Boolean, String, String) method and an optional request body passed to this method.

This method causes an HTTP request to be issued. If there has been no previous call to open(JsXMLHttpRequest, String, String, Boolean), or, more generally, if JsXMLHttpRequest.readyState is not JsXMLHttpRequest.OPEN, this method throws an error. Otherwise, it issues an HTTP request that consists of:

  • The HTTP method, URL, and authorization credentials (if any) specified in the previous call to open(JsXMLHttpRequest, String, String, Boolean, String, String).
  • The request headers, if any, specified by previous calls to setRequestHeader(JsXMLHttpRequest, String, String).
  • The body argument passed to this method.
Once the request has been issued, this method sets JsXMLHttpRequest.readyState to JsXMLHttpRequest.SENT and triggers the JsXMLHttpRequest.onreadystatechange event handler.

If the async argument to the previous call to open(JsXMLHttpRequest, String, String, Boolean, String, String) was false, this method blocks and does not return until JsXMLHttpRequest.readyState is JsXMLHttpRequest.LOADED and the server's response has been fully received. Otherwise, if the async argument is true or if that argument is undefined, this method returns immediately, and the server's response is processed on a background thread.

If the server responds with an HTTP redirect, this method or the background thread follow the redirect automatically. When all HTTP response headers have been received, this method or the background thread sets JsXMLHttpRequest.readyState to JsXMLHttpRequest.RECEIVING and triggers the JsXMLHttpRequest.onreadystatechange event handler. If the response is long, this method or the background thread may trigger the JsXMLHttpRequest.onreadystatechange more than once while in state JsXMLHttpRequest.RECEIVING. This can serve as a download progress indicator. Finally, when the response is complete, this method or the background thread sets JsXMLHttpRequest.readyState to JsXMLHttpRequest.LOADED and triggers the event handler one last time.

Parameters:
http - The current HTTP request.
body - If the HTTP method specified by the call to open(JsXMLHttpRequest, String, String, Boolean, String, String) is "POST" or "PUT", this argument specifies the body of the request, as a string or JsDocument object, or null if no body is necessary. For any other method, this argument is unused and should be null, but some implementations do not allow you to omit this argument.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
open(JsXMLHttpRequest, String, String), open(JsXMLHttpRequest, String, String, Boolean), open(JsXMLHttpRequest, String, String, Boolean, String, String), JsXMLHttpRequest.send(Object)

setRequestHeader

public static final void setRequestHeader(JsXMLHttpRequest http,
                                          java.lang.String name,
                                          java.lang.String value)

Sets or adds an HTTP request header to an open but unsent request.

This method specifies an HTTP request header that should be included in the request issued by a subsequent call to send(JsXMLHttpRequest, Object). This method may be called only when JsXMLHttpRequest.readyState is JsXMLHttpRequest.OPEN, that is, after a call to open(JsXMLHttpRequest, String, String, Boolean, String, String) but before a call to send(JsXMLHttpRequest, Object).

If a header with the specified name has already been specified, the new value for that header is the previously specified value, plus a comma, a space, and the value specified in this call.

If the call to open(JsXMLHttpRequest, String, String, Boolean, String, String) specifies authorization credentials, JsClient.XMLHttpRequest automatically sends an appropriate Authorization request header. You can append to this header with this method, however. Similarly, if the web browser has stored cookies associated with the URL passed to open(JsXMLHttpRequest, String, String, Boolean, String, String), appropriate Cookie or Cookie2 headers are automatically included with the request. You can append additional cookies to these headers by calling this method. JsClient.XMLHttpRequest may also provide a default value for the User-Agent header. If it does this, any value you specify for that header is appended to the default value.

Some request headers are automatically set by the JsClient.XMLHttpRequest for conformance to the HTTP protocol and may not be set with this method. These include proxy-related headers as well as the following:

  • Host
  • Connection
  • Keep-Alive
  • Accept-Charset
  • Accept-Encoding
  • If-Modified-Since
  • If-None-Match
  • If-Range
  • Range

Parameters:
http - The current HTTP request.
name - The name of the header to be set. This argument should not contain spaces, colons, linefeeds, or newlines.
value - The value for the header. This argument should not contain linefeeds or newlines.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
JsXMLHttpRequest.setRequestHeader(String, String)
